text: Hi, is there any julia version/equivalent of interp3() in matlab. I have 3 vectors (x, y, z) of which I want to interpolate via lookup of an array, V. In matlab, one just run interp3(x, y, z, V, xn, yn, zn) but I'm struggling to replicate such in julia using Interpolation.jl. Help needed

elements.text: Hi, is there any julia version/equivalent of interp3() in matlab. I have 3 vectors (x, y, z) of which I want to interpolate via lookup of an array, V. In matlab, one just run interp3(x, y, z, V, xn, yn, zn) but I'm struggling to replicate such in julia using Interpolation.jl. Help needed

text:
I think you would interpolate `V` using `Gridded` on grid points specified by `x,y,z` and then evaluate on `xq,yq,zq` , i.e:
```V_interp = interpolate((x,y,z),V,Gridded(Linear()))
out = V_interp(xq,yq,zq)```
Thanks, I figured it out. Once again, I think some of those documentation need real example.
